intro: Lepyrodiclis stellarioides, commonly known as the starlike daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant has a low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is native to southern Africa and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in regions with suitable climates.
